title: 6l Segfault
body:
by **m4cpunk**: 
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull -u" and retry what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. 6g SomeProg.go
2. 6l SomeProg.6

What is the expected output?
Error message or 6.out file

What do you see instead?
fish: Job 1, “6l QVMDisas.6” terminated by signal SIGSEGV (Address boundary error)

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g

Which operating system are you using?
Linux my-laptop 2.6.35-24-generic #42-Ubuntu SMP Thu Dec 2 02:41:37 UTC 2010 x86_64
GNU/Linux

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
d8ba80011a98 release/release.2011-01-20

Please provide any additional information below.
Core was generated by `6l QVMDisas.6'.
Program terminated with signal 11, Segmentation fault.
#0  defgotype (gotype=0x7fb78ef5bad0) at ../ld/dwarf.c:1115
1115			newrefattr(die, DW_AT_internal_key_type, defgotype(s));
(gdb) bt
#0  defgotype (gotype=0x7fb78ef5bad0) at ../ld/dwarf.c:1115
#1  0x0000000000407668 in defdwsymb (sym=0x20, s=<value optimized out>, t=9, 
    v=4670032, size=<value optimized out>, ver=16843009, gotype=0x0)
    at ../ld/dwarf.c:1444
#2  0x00000000004013b6 in genasmsym (put=0x4074c0 <defdwsymb>)
    at /home/macpunk/go/src/cmd/6l/asm.c:1148
#3  0x0000000000409a59 in dwarfemitdebugsections () at ../ld/dwarf.c:2316
#4  0x0000000000403054 in asmb () at /home/macpunk/go/src/cmd/6l/asm.c:844
#5  0x0000000000414865 in p9main (argc=1, argv=0x7fff9febc9b0)
    at /home/macpunk/go/src/cmd/6l/obj.c:255
#6  0x000000000041a8e9 in main (argc=9, argv=0x0)
    at /home/macpunk/go/src/lib9/main.c:35
(gdb) q


It appears to be something in my program QVMDisas.go. However, the linker generally
doesn't handle errors by crashing. The classic "Hello, World!" compiles and
links just fine.
